title: So, Bard Discussion

embed.description: The Wandering Caretaker The celestial vagabond known only as Bard dwells beyond the physical universe in realms unknown to man. Manifesting when others threaten the cosmic equilibrium, the ancient caretaker acts with speed and intent, only returning to his endless watch once he has steered Runeterra from catastrophe.

body:
Put a link to the reveal page in case anyone hadn't seen it yet.

Anywho, I'm honestly just curious GD, what do you all think about the newest support? What kind of questions and ideas do you have for him? I can see many things being brought up about him, and I'm honestly curious what you all think.

Some of the things I was thinking was...
1. Will Bard's ult have any effect on Dominion Turrets/Any Mode Nexus/TT Altars?
2. As it is-- Bard's E seems to be literally useless on Howling abyss, due to the lack of walls outside of the stage limits. 
3. A lot of people are asking, how often will the little chimes appear? They seem to be close together in the video, but I notice suddenly no more appear.
4. What roles can this guy do? He seems like he could be an EXCELLENT jungler (free experience just for doing what you do anyways? OP.) and could work as a roaming mid as well. Another thing someone brought up is have Every lane solo-- solo top, solo mid, and marksman bot-- while having the jungler in the... jungle and bard following him around, and going where needed.

So, GD, any thoughts on any of these points/questions or any of your own?

replies.body:
Hey there! I can answer these questions!

1.a. Right now, it **does not ** hit Dominion Turrets (it's cooler to just hit the people channeling, and they serve a very different purpose than turrets on SR)

1.b. It doesn't hit Nexuses (Nexies?) or Inhibitors - there's no reason to hit the enemy Nexus besides trolling, and I like the symmetry on the spell. I'd like to keep it focused on clearer plays, too.  

1.c. In general it doesn't hit untargetable things, and there's nothing to hit on the TT altars, so nope :)


2 - I'm interested to see how he plays out on Howling Abyss - he can cut the base wall corners and end up way into the lane, and can jump from brush to brush in the middle of the map. He can flank pretty hard, and might be a big force multiplier for an Udyr or similar. We'll see. Can always up his Chime spawn rate to compensate!

3 - Right now, the chimes show up two at a time about once a minute. Definitely a balance lever, though

4 - That remains to be seen. Jungle Bard is definitely *possible*, but I'm not sure if it's viable or not. As for double-jungle with a support, his W and E definitely synergize hugely. If that's a thing that happens, I'll be super excited.

If Bard sees play in the Jungle he's going to be nerfed into the ground.

As for the questions...

1.b. I wasn't thinking of it like that, moreso if you're trying to save your OWN nexus-- say your team got aced, and you're the first alive-- and you need about 10 seconds at most for the rest of your team to revive. Could you delay defeat by putting your own nexus in stasis?


Point 2-- Wow, really? Exactly how far would he be able to jump? Cause if he just went forward, he could go on the southwest wall (right before you leave the base on the ghost side) and go forward, and end up all the way in the enemy team's base. And as for chimes-- they could be real trouble for him, trying to collect them at least, especially if they spawn too far forward, kind of like Zac's blob's flying towards an enemy.

Point 4-- I'd like to see it. Imagine a Jungle Rek'sai with a roaming support Bard-- instead of doing the obvious tunnels, Bard could put a portal through a wall into a lane, rek'sai following through, then using the tunnel as a gapcloser on the person he's ganking. (Thinking mostly top or bot lane, at least.)

**It should still be qualified as a form of CC, so they would ignore it.**

Soraka's wish hits champions in stasis and untargetable, if it doesn't it is probably a glitch.

Off the top of my head here's the run-down on how to start him as a support.
Start shrine
Drop two shrines top
Drop a shrine mid
Go to lane/jungle leash.

Now your top and mid have the sustain to beat out their lane opponent (the two top since it's usually an island).

By the time one is used you will be level 2+ and after harassing bot lane be able to drop one for you or your carry.



Another way to start is starting your tunnel and tunnels enemies buff for your jungler to snag right away, in and out so to speak.


Don't see him working out top lane solo. Would be a very niche pick into very few champions.

Jungler he'd be fine jungling. Ganks wouldn't be super strong as landing a Q on enemy or enemy + terrain/minion/mulitple enemies would be hard to pull off.

As a support I would rank him mid tier. Mainly for his ability to help out his top/mid early enough. 
All the other supports will win out and he shouldn't see much play after first week or two. Highly doubtful he will see any competitive play at all until he is tweaked/re-worked.

That does seem a very good plan, but it depends on how high his base movement speed is. I'm actually thinking it'll be somewhat *low* due to his passive speed boost. (Similar to how Varus's starting AS is super low but his passive makes up for it) It also depends on how LONG these shrines last-- if they only last 30 or 40 seconds that won't help much. (Also depends on cooldown-- if it's like, a 20 second cooldown, and they last for 1 minute-- one of the top ones would expire before you finished placing all of them.)

He seems like a support that can do very well if the team understands him-- so I think he'll be pretty strong in ranked 5's. But he's also a champion that requires a lot of communication to do well-- it isn't like Kalista where you grab your soulbound and let them figure out what's going on in the next 2 seconds.

If I recall, the shrines last until used and can only have 3 up at a time. 12 second cool down. So you'd be able to get them all down and move around as needed.

And you are very correct that it will take lots of coordination.

This tactic sounds a lot like the Zac run in alone, die, entire team TP's in from his blobs trick. Of course, you'd have to figure out exactly where their jungler is starting-- and junglers don't just do red or blue first this season.
I was nodding my head in agreement until your last two sentences, it remains to be seen how he'll do in soloque but in competitive? They'll be all over this guy.

Let me explain a little bit.
While his health is nice (think about dropping three shrines for a 2v1 on your top laner (wherever he is). His harass is a q, which will only slow 90% of the time. Competitive players will be able to dodge a lot more than most players so getting a snare/stun (Whatever you want to call it) will be a lot harder. 

Shrines post laning phase won't be much. I foresee them as surviving a last tick of ignite (if placed well) or for speed boost catching/running. 

Tunnel would be create interesting game play. As stated running into a fight from fog/terrain. But not too terrible much can be done.

His ultimate is his saving grace for competitive play. Both saving allies and getting good engages off. That being said the range and interaction will be intriguing. 

Like I stated there are better supports that will take over. Think along the lines of how little champions are played out of the numbers we have. It won't be relegated for top tier picks.
I think he's a support, he has a Free Zhonya's effect, heals, movement speed, with only 1 real poke.
He is confirmed a support, a roaming one at that.

I'll go down your points and then throw some random stuff in on my own.

1. I imagine there wouldn't be an effect on any of those things as it could be potentially a complete disaster on any other map. I could potentially see the Nexus, but I think that's probably unlikely.

2. You're right this would be entirely useless, so that would be quite disappointing to get stuck with, but Riot has always had their large focus on SR, for obvious reasons, so I doubt this will change much if at all.

3. I'm also very curious, and do they occur everywhere on the map, or exclusively through jungle and river areas. Like would you have them in lanes if you were roaming through?

4. I could see him working as a jungler, might be difficult due to the lack of damage he's likely to have, but the whole, skillshot that stuns from hitting walls as well as other enemies/minions/monsters, could work to a pretty good advantage, plus with the extra XP from chimes and damage from meeps, he could be the fastest leveling jungler in the game with some pretty solid clear times.. Someone suggested potential for mid and top lane, though I find a hard time picturing him for that just because it's difficult for a solo laner to leave without having pushed your laner out, and Bard is lacking in damaging abilities to do that effectively.

As for my points now.

I actually really like the concept of this "Support" he's going to come out of the gate a little OP, as I'm sure we all expect, but I think he can be very healthy for the game. He'll teach supports how to start roaming and influencing other lanes properly, will force ADCs to not lean on their support like a crutch in place of their own leg, also provides a lot of opportunities for major plays. I would bet he'll walk out with a high difficulty rating, while he seems relatively simple, you have to balance your roams with helping your ADC.

Another thing is that he'll be a support that's actually capable of dealing with minion waves pushing in, with some decent base damages from what I can tell, he'll also have the meeps to make his auto attacks a bit of a pass through skillshot, meaning he'll have some manner of wave clear if his ADC died, and will be able to defend his turret rather effectively if he's been roaming and such like he should. He's going to be a heavy impact support for the entire game, in all places of the game, so it could cause a bit more interest in supporting, but I won't hold my breath on that.

Finally how exactly do the health packs work? Do they stay for Teemo shroom lengths of time? Steath ward lengths of time? Is it a Shaco Box? A Maokai sappling? It obviously says it takes a few seconds to charge, but afterwards does it just hang out forever? How many of them can you have out? Does it operate like a spell with a CD or like a stacking item with a recharge?

I'll admit it's got me curious to try supporting with him.
While he seems relatively *Simple
ty for the proofing.
He E can be casted in the air on HA. Problem solved.

Broken, completely fucking broken. I mean release Thresh level broken. He's gonna come out strong, people will suck with him, get QoL buffs, people will be good with him and he'll have a 58% winrate. Then there will be lots of QQ and he'll have half of his kit nerfed over 4 patches.

Well, while his kit seems very good, I can't imagine his ratios (AP wise, at least) will be too oppressively high. Release Thresh (and well, Thresh in general) has a very stacked kit, so he is strong no matter what his numbers. (Unless they like, completely removed the damage from his ult.)
Eh. His ult, and Q could do no damage and it wouldn't impact him that much, it's only his E's damage being messed with that would likely cause him to take a big hit.

Well, even if they did lower his E's damage-- heck, even if they literally removed all damage from his kit, Thresh would STILL be useful simply due to the sheer amount of utility he provides. He has a Pull/Dash that locks someone down for a few seconds, a Shield that can literally save someone from anything, an E that displaces, can be chained easily off of Q>Dash, and counts for Yasuo's Last Breath, and a 99% slow ult in a pentagonal form around thresh-- even without damage, Thresh simply does a ton of things too well.
Ya, but his E is the only reason anyone takes the Relic Shield line on him which is the only way for him to get sustain in his kit (The one thing it lacks).
True. Although, he COULD farm without Flay's passive. It just makes it easier.
The most important question, can he E through things like {{champion:34}}  or {{champion:268}}  walls?
Is Bard's ultimate a projectile and being blocked by Yasuo Wall/Braum Shield? How does it interact with Braum's shield?

From the video, it does seem to have a trajectory, but it depends on if it travels more like Corki Q or Ziggs R.  Also, we don't know if it'll stop and activate where it hits, or just disappear entirely.

1. Unless Riot gets lazy, it should affect Dominion Turrets and Nexus turrets. It shouldn't affect fountain obelisks.
2. It might work with turrets and inhibitors... Considering its range, it might be able to link up along the line made by two turrets (or a turret+inhib, or the Nexus). Structures (destroyed or not) count as terrain for abilities like Nautilus' Q; I don't see why Riot wouldn't allow Bard to use his E on them. His E's usefulness on ARAM will depend on whether the portal ends right after the first terrain it goes through, or if the portal actually goes to the end of its range (if there is another bit of terrain to "link" with).
3. Unknown. Wait for him to hit the PBE.
4. He might be able to jungle, but he only has two sources of damage (meeps and Q) and doesn't seem to be focused around building auto-attack enhancement items (mainly AD).
